info.title: Fulfillment API
info.description:
- alpha: Currently developed API version. Subject to major changes.
- beta: A semi-stable early access version. New features can be added. Breaking changes are possible.
- stable: The API is recommended for use in production.

[Changelog](https://fulfillment-api.conqore.niceshops.com/v2/docs/changelog.html)

All data is transferred in UTF-8 encoding.\
The API uses stateless HTTP. No cookies have to be kept.\
Authentication via OAuth2 client credentials flow.

[Fulfillment API PHP client @Packagist](https://packagist.org/packages/datenkraft/bb-fulfillment-api-php-client)

get.summary: Get an inbound delivery by inbound delivery number.
get.description: Get an inbound delivery by inbound delivery number.

parameters.name: inboundDeliveryNumber
parameters.description: The inbound delivery number as defined during the creation of the inbound delivery.

parameters.name: shopCode
parameters.description:
The shopCode used internally to distinguish between clients.
_This code is optional, if your identity is assigned to only one shop. Otherwise the response would be a 422 HTTP Error._

post.description: Add a new inbound delivery referenced by the given deliveryNumber.

parameters.name: inboundDeliveryNumber
parameters.description:
The number the inbound delivery should be refered by.
    This number is user defined, must be unique and has a maximum length (check maxLength field).

parameters.name: shopCode
parameters.description:
The shopCode used internally to distinguish between clients.
_This code is optional, if your identity is assigned to only one shop. Otherwise the response would be a 422 HTTP Error._

get.summary: Get a list of inbound deliveries.
get.description: Get a list of inbound deliveries.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page to read. Default is the first page.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum size per page is 100. Default is 100.

parameters.name: filter[status]
parameters.description:
Status of the inbound delivery (optional).

The status for not yet completed is subject to change. you may poll for changes.
- open: The inbound delivery has not yet been delivered.
- in_progress: The inbound delivery is being processed in our warehouse.
- completed: The inbound delivery has been processed in our warehouse.
- deleted: The inbound delivery has been deleted.

parameters.name: filter[shopCode]
parameters.description:
The shopCode used internally to distinguish between clients.
_This code is optional, if your identity is assigned to only one shop. Otherwise the response would be a 422 HTTP Error._

post.description: Cancel a inbound delivery referenced by the given deliveryNumber.

parameters.name: inboundDeliveryNumber
parameters.description:
The number the inbound delivery should be refered by.
    This number is user defined, must be unique and has a maximum length (check maxLength field).

parameters.name: shopCode
parameters.description:
The shopCode used internally to distinguish between clients.
_This code is optional, if your identity is assigned to only one shop. Otherwise the response would be a 422 HTTP Error._

get.summary: Get the stock for all (per default only valid) products or for a specific product.
get.description: Get the stock for all (per default only valid) products or for a specific product.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page to read. Default is the first page.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum size per page is 100. Default is 20.

parameters.name: filter[productNumber]
parameters.description: product number

parameters.name: filter[shopCode]
parameters.description:
The shopCode used internally to distinguish between clients.
_This code is optional, if your identity is assigned to only one shop. Otherwise the response would be a 422 HTTP Error._

parameters.name: filter[productStatus]
parameters.description:
filter for productStatus\
By default, only valid products (available or in stock) are returned.\
Use '_all' to return all products (also invalid products)\
Use '_invalid' to specifically return invalid products (not available and out of stock)

get.summary: Get an order by order number.
get.description: Get an order by order number.

parameters.name: orderNumber
parameters.description: The order number as defined during the creation of the order.

parameters.name: shopCode
parameters.description:
The shopCode used internally to distinguish between clients.
_This code is optional, if your identity is assigned to only one shop. Otherwise the response would be a 422 HTTP Error._

post.description: Add a new order referenced by the given orderNumber.

parameters.name: orderNumber
parameters.description:
The number the order should be refered by.
    This number is user defined, must be unique and has a maximum length (check maxLength field).

post.description: Cancel the order specified by the given order number (set in param orderNumber).

parameters.name: orderNumber
parameters.description: The number the order is refered by.

parameters.name: shopCode
parameters.description:
The shopCode used internally to distinguish between clients.
_This code is optional, if your identity is assigned to only one shop. Otherwise the response would be a 422 HTTP Error._

409.description:
Conflict

Available message codes:
- ORDER_NOT_CANCELABLE: The order could not be canceled anymore
- ORDER_ALREADY_CANCELED: The order is already canceled
- ORDER_CANCELLATION_ALREADY_EXISTS: An order cancellation request already exists, which needs manual approval

get.summary: Get a list of shop oders.
get.description: Get a list of shop orders.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page to read. Default is the first page.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum size per page is 100. Default is 100.

parameters.name: filter[shopCode]
parameters.description:
The shopCode used internally to distinguish between clients.
_This code is optional, if your identity is assigned to only one shop. Otherwise the response would be a 422 HTTP Error._

parameters.name: filter[status]
parameters.description: Filter for status/statuses (optional).

parameters.name: filter[externalOrderId]
parameters.description: Filter for the external order ID e.g. from third party apps (optional)

post.description:
Redact the order and all other orders linked to the given order number (set in the param orderNumber) in a GDPR article 17 conform way.
Only orders with one of the following statuses are redactable: - delivered - deleted - canceled

parameters.name: orderNumber
parameters.description: The number the order is refered by.

parameters.name: shopCode
parameters.description:
The shopCode used internally to distinguish between clients.
_This code is optional, if your identity is assigned to only one shop. Otherwise the response would be a 422 HTTP Error._

409.description:
Conflict

Available message codes:
- ORDER_NOT_REDACTABLE: The order is not redactable because of status conflicts
- ORDER_ALREADY_REDACTED: The order is already redacted

get.summary: Get deliveries filtered by a single or multiple order numbers.
get.description: Get deliveries filtered by a single or multiple order numbers.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page to read. Default is the first page.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum size per page is 100. Default is 100.

parameters.name: filter[orderNumber]
parameters.description:
A filter for a single order number or multiple order numbers separted by a comma.
- The filter can contain a maximum of 100 order numbers.
- The order numbers in the filter must be unique.
- A single order number can have a maximum length of 59 characters.

parameters.name: shopCode
parameters.description:
The shopCode used internally to distinguish between clients.
_This code is optional, if your identity is assigned to only one shop. Otherwise the response would be a 422 HTTP Error._

deliveryShipment.description: A shipments defines a single delivered entity (package, parcel, pallet, ...)

status.description:
Status of the delivery.
- in_progress: The delivery is in the process of being packaged.
- delivered: The delivery has been transferred to the delivery agent.

deliveryService.description:
The delivery service used to send this delivery.
The codes of supported delivery services can be retrieved from the 'GET /delivery-service' endpoint.

link.description: Link to the carrier's tracking site

shipmentLine.description: One piece of content in a shipment

count.description: Number of items contained in the delivery

externalShipmentId.description: The external id of the shipment

orderNumber.description: The order number. Note: This can be null if the delivery has no associated order.

status.description:
Status of the delivery.
- in_progress: The delivery is in the process of being packaged.
- delivered: The delivery has been transferred to the delivery agent.

shipments.description: List of shipments (= package, parcel, pallet, ...)

productType.description: Type of the product ('standard' if no value is provided)

productStatus.description: Status of the product regarding sales ('enabled' if no value is provided)

articleVariantTitle.description:
The title of the article variant. \
Must not be set when the articleVariantType is 'standard_autotitle'.

articleVariantType.description:
The type of the article variant ('standard_autotitle' if no value is provided). \
The articleVariantType 'standard_autotitle' is only allowed for the variantGroup 'content'

articleStatus.description: Status of the article regarding visibility ('active' if no value is provided)

contentsAmount.description: Amount of the product contents (1 if no value is provided)

contentsUnit.description: Unit of the product contents ('stk' if no value is provided).

contentsWeightGram.description: Weight of the product contents in gram

weightGram.description: Total weight of the product in gram

variantGroup.description: The variant group of the product

taricCode.description: The TARIC code of the product

listPriceEUR.description: The list price of the product in EUR

suggestedRetailPriceEUR.description: The suggested retail price for the product in EUR

taxCode.description:
One of the available tax codes.
- std: Standard tax rate (AT 20%)
- spc: 1st tax rate (AT 13%)
- erm: 2nd tax rate (AT 10%)
- erm3: 3rd tax rate (AT 5%)
- nsp: not taxable (0%)

manufacturerCountryCode.description: Country code of the manufacturer (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2)

languageCode.description: The language code used for the product (ISO 639-1)

newProduct.title: newProduct
newProduct.description: Data to create a new product

articleShortDescription.description:
Short description of the article. \
Note: This can be null if the product was not created via the API.

shopCode.description: The shop to which the product belongs

newInboundDelivery.title: newInboundDelivery
newInboundDelivery.description: Data to create a new inbound delivery

supplierNumber.description: Number of the supplier. Available suppliers can be retrieved from the 'GET /supplier' endpoint.

inboundDelivery.title: inboundDelivery
inboundDelivery.description: Data to represent an inbound delivery

shopWAWIDeliveryId.description: The API internal id of the inbound delivery.

status.description:
Status of the inbound delivery.
The status for not yet completed is subject to change. you may poll for changes.
- open: The inbound delivery has not yet been delivered.
- in_progress: The inbound delivery is being processed in our warehouse.
- completed: The inbound delivery has been processed in our warehouse.
- deleted: The inbound delivery has been deleted.

shopCode.description: The shopCode used internally to distinguish between clients.

announcedCount.description: Number of announced products in the inbound delivery

deliveredCount.description: Number of actual delivered products in the inbound delivery

announcedCount.description: Number of announced products in the inbound delivery

deliveryService.title: deliveryService
deliveryService.description: Data to represent a delivery service

shopCode.description: The shopCode used internally to distinguish between clients.

newOrder.title: newOrder
newOrder.description: Data to create a new order

externalOrderId.description: The external order ID e.g. from third party apps.

baseOrderOptions.title: baseOrderOptions
baseOrderOptions.description: Additional optional options for the order.

newOrderOptions.title: newOrderOptions
newOrderOptions.description: Additional optional options for a new order.

autoProcessState.description:
By setting this option, the order will be processed into the defined state.\
This option is NOT available in the production systems.\
The autoprocessing of the state happens after the order has been sucessfully created.
In case of any errors during the autoprocessing of the state, error messages are shown but the order will still have been created and is not rolled back.

Available states:
- order_completed_single_delivery: The order is completely delivered within one shipment
- order_completed_multiple_deliveries: The order is completely delivered and includes several shipments
- order_partially_delivered: The order is in progress and one of several shipments is delivered
- order_canceled: The order is canceled
- order_locked: The order is locked

orderNumber.description: The order number. Note: This can be null if the order as not created via the API.

orderItems.description: Note: canceled orderItems are NOT included.

status.description:
The current status of the order.
- new: The order was created but not every required information was given. The order can not be processed without manual intervention.
- processing: The order is being processed. For split deliveries, some of the shipments might have already been transferred to the delivery agent.
- delivered: The orders shipments have all been transferred to the delivery agent.
- deleted: The order has been cancelled.
- locked: The order is locked. The order can not be processed without manual intervention.
- examination: The order has been manually locked.  The order can not be processed without manual intervention.

orderDate.description: The create date for the order. Default is the current date. Format in ISO 8601

externalOrderId.description: The external order ID e.g. from third party apps.

count.description: Positive number of items to order

value.description: The price value rounded to 2 decimals, dot as separator

languageCode.description: The language code for any customer communications (ISO 639-1)

phone.description: The customer's phone number, preferably in the DIN 5008 format, like:+43 2236 123456-7890

orderPayment.title: orderPayment
orderPayment.description: Options regarding the payment of the order

orderShipping.title: orderShipping
orderShipping.description: Options regarding the shipping of the order

deliveryService.description:
The delivery service to recommend for usage.
The codes of supported delivery services can be retrieved from the 'GET /delivery-service' endpoint.

orderDelivery.title: orderDelivery
orderDelivery.description: The delivery for the order. Details can be read by GET /delivery/.

reportClearingOrderCollection.title: reportClearingOrderCollection
reportClearingOrderCollection.description: A collection of orders for clearing

orderNumber.description: The order number. Note: This can be null if the order was not created via the API.

shopOrderId.description: The API internal id of the order.

country.description: Data to represent a country, steve can ship to

phoneRequired.description: Specifies whether or not a phone number is required when using a shipping address in the country

stocked.description: Amount stocked in the warehouse - without considering the reserved amount for ongoing orders

available.description: Amount available for orders - with the reserved amount for ongoing orders taken into account

shopCode.description: The shopCode used internally to distinguish between clients

internalReferencePrefix.description: The prefix to the references internally to distinguish between clients.

testShop.description: Flag to mark a shop used for testing.

testShopResetNotBefore.description: Date time to indicate that the test shop will not be reset before this time.

sandboxMode.description: Flag to mark a shop in sandbox mode.

addTestSuffixToInternalReference.description: Flag to mark if a test suffix should be added to internal references.

testShopResetNotBefore.description: Date time to indicate that the test shop will not be reset before this time.

sandboxMode.description: Flag to mark a shop in sandbox mode.

addTestSuffixToInternalReference.description: Flag to mark if a test suffix should be added to internal references.

page.description: The page contained in this collection.

pageSize.description: The page size used for reading the collection.
